title: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Red Wine?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a bottle of red wine (standard 750ml), plus carbs, alcohol impact, full nutrition breakdown, and tweaks for sweet or dry varieties.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Red Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle, dry red wine (~13% ABV), table wine like Cabernet or Merlot; no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type (dry vs. sweet), alcohol content, brand, vintage, and serving size. Alcohol provides ~7 kcal per gram. Consult labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750ml bottle of dry red wine has about 625 calories, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 oz mixers like soda per glass (5 glasses)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of red wine?
faqs.a: About 125 calories in a standard 5 oz (150 ml) serving of dry red wine.

faqs.q: Does red wine have a lot of carbs?
faqs.a: Dry red wine has low carbs (~4 g per glass), mostly from residual sugars; sweeter varieties have more.

faqs.q: Why are calories high in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: Primarily from alcohol (7 kcal/g); a 750ml bottle has ~80-90g alcohol, contributing most of the 625 kcal.

faqs.q: How does red vs. white wine compare in calories?
faqs.a: Similar; both ~625 kcal per 750ml bottle for dry varieties, but whites may have slightly more sugars.

faqs.q: Does bottle size affect calories in red wine?
faqs.a: Yes; a 375ml half-bottle has ~310 kcal, while a 1.5L magnum doubles to ~1250 kcal.
